entry.title: 苹果拉动贝拉·拉姆西（Bella Ramsey）广告，该广告推广了蒸发软件个性化的siri功能
entry.content:
扎克·霍尔（Zac Hall），9to5mac：

自去年秋天以来，Apple一直使用未发行的Siri功能来销售iPhone 16和Apple Intelligence。在今天确认Siri的个人版本不会很快到来之后，Apple已将广告提取了。

商业出演的贝拉·拉姆西（Bella Ramsey）可能因像西里（Siri）一样的表演而获得奖项。

在广告地点，拉姆齐看到有人熟悉，并向西里询问了他们上个月在一家特定餐厅开会的人的名字。

Siri立即根据日历事件，电子邮件或Ramsey的iPhone上的消息做出了响应。

我认为这是苹果唯一展示了苹果公司已承认不会在iOS 18中运送的“个性化Siri”功能的电视广告，但在棒球季后赛和NFL赛季中，我看到了很多商业广告。 （我倾向于在观看体育运动时只看电视广告。）他们是否经营其他广告或广告牌来宣传这一不存在的功能？我想知道，既然他们已经意识到，这些功能今年将发货是一种幻想。

Apple的Apple Intelligence ， iOS 18和Macos 15红杉的产品页面很糟糕，提到了这些“ Siri的新时代”功能， 我们现在知道今年不会发货。这是一个营销惨败。

entry.title: 苹果个性化Siri Apple Intelligence延迟的路透社
entry.content:
斯蒂芬·内利斯（Stephen Nellis），向路透社报道：

该公司周五表示，对苹果语音助理Siri的一些人工智能改进将推迟到2026年。

苹果在一份声明中说，它“一直在研究更个性化的Siri，使其对您的个人环境有了更多的了解，以及在应用程序内部和跨应用程序中采取行动的能力。这将花费我们的时间比我们想象的要花费的时间更长，并且我们预计在来年将它们推出。”

我真的并不是要过分学业（所以自从原始出版物以来已经编辑了这篇文章），但是苹果的声明在“来年”上写道，所以我认为我们有可能在2025年底之前在iOS 19.0、19.1或19.2中看到这些功能。我想打赌吗？否。这感觉就像是一个重置，而不仅仅是“我们需要几个月”类型的东西。

苹果没有给出延误的理由。 iPhone制造商以前曾表示该功能将于2025年出现。

同样，发毛，但我实际上认为“这将花费我们比我们想象的更长的时间”是一个很好的解释。

entry.summary: 这一公告令人失望，但并不奇怪。如果苹果公司的总体政策在准备就绪之前不运送产品，则适用于涉及LLM访问深度私人式内部设备信息的产品十倍。
entry.content:
这是我今天早上从苹果发言人杰奎琳·罗伊（Jacqueline Roy）逐字了解的声明：

“ Siri帮助我们的用户找到了他们的需求并快速完成工作，在过去的六个月中，我们使Siri更加对话，引入了新功能，例如Type of Siri和产品知识，并与Chatgpt添加了集成。我们还一直在研究一个更个性化的Siri，使其对您的个人背景有了更多的了解，以及在您的应用程序内部和跨应用程序中采取行动的能力。这将花费我们的时间比我们想象的要花费的时间更长，并且我们预计在来年将它们推出。”

这是一个星期五的Wah-Waaah悲伤的脚步新闻，但苹果公司登上它并准确设定期望是很好的。

读这条线之间的读物以及根据我在库比蒂诺 - 埃斯（Cupertino-Ese）中的博士学位流利度，苹果在这里所说的是，这些“更个性化的Siri”功能从今年的OS周期到明年：iOS 19和MacOS 16。这些年有效地从WWDC开始。从苹果的角度来看，问题是他们没有谈论未来的产品。他们尚未正式承认将要有iOS 19或MacOS 16。他们甚至还没有宣布将有一个WWDC 2025。但是他们确实希望准确地设定期望，尤其是对于苹果自己的营销推动力的高知名度（例如Apple Intellionce）。所以我们在这里。

这些功能在iOS 18.4/macOS 15.4中并没有出现，因为它们不在开发人员的Beta中。如果这些功能在iOS 18.5/macOS 15.5甚至iOS 18.6/macOS 15.6中出现，那么苹果就不会觉得有必要发表“这需要我们比我们想象的更长的……”声明。在iOS 18.5甚至18.6中提供“更个性化的Siri”本来会按照最初宣布的时间表进行交付，这是从WWDC 2024开始的“即将到来的一年”。那将是那个“年”的尾声，但在其中。但是，苹果仅限于自我强加的库比蒂诺 - 埃斯（Cupertino-Ese）的不透明词，但不会阐明这一点。但是请相信我，您可以依靠它：他们今天宣布的是，这些功能在iOS 19/MacOS 16中出现。

Siri在今年的OS周期（iOS/iPados 18 + MacOS 15红杉）中的苹果智能伞下的几种有用但迭代的方法有所改善，但是去年6月在WWDC上展出的大型“个性化的Siri”是Siri相关的Apple Intelligence，这些东西是人们，人们对此很兴奋，最令人兴奋。这是“ 应用程序意图”的内容 - 需要Siri可以访问并有效地了解您的个人信息的功能，并在您的应用程序中私下存储在您的设备上。这些是Apple Intelligence最有用的，最实用的，最实用的，最未来派的特征。而且它们是Apple几乎独特地提供的功能，仅与Google一起作为移动平台和设备生态系统的提供商。

根据苹果自己的公告，在WWDC主题演讲之后：

Siri将能够提供针对用户及其设备信息量身定制的情报。例如，用户可以说：“播放杰米推荐的那个播客”，而Siri将找到和播放该集，而无需记住该播放，而不必记住它是在文本还是电子邮件中提到的。或者他们可以问：“妈妈的飞行何时登陆？” Siri将找到飞行的详细信息，并通过实时飞行跟踪交叉引用，以提供到达时间。

“妈妈什么时候登陆？”我们的人类很容易理解，这是一个很好的例子，说明了那种显然有用的Siri互动。但是您也可以轻松地看到它在苹果方面的复杂程度。 Siri长期以来能够做“妈妈”的事情。您的配偶，您的孩子 - 您早已能够告诉Siri以这样的昵称给这些人打电话或发短信。但是，从您的电子邮件中获取妈妈的飞行信息（我认为这是WWDC主题演示中此演示的前提 - 飞行信息被存储在邮件中或短信中，然后知道如何检查该航班的当前飞行状态信息，这远远超出了当前Siri的Ken。获取信息需要访问您的最个人信息 - 您自己的电子邮件和消息。从您的消息中获取正确的信息需要一种常见的理解，即您显然在询问妈妈正在询问的某种目前的旅行，而不是她向您发送了一封电子邮件，她向您发送了有关2019年的航班，即2022年，甚至是去年12月的一台飞行。我们目前知道的Siri缺乏这种常识。最后，在从电子邮件中获取正确的航班后，执行此任务要求Siri让该机构可以查找该特定航班的当前状态，并在每次提供答案时正确地将其正确处理。

如果Siri回答说：“您妈妈的航班今天下午4:30到达，目前正在显示准时到达，”您确实希望该信息正确，如果您答应将她接送在机场。如果您开车去机场，您会很生气，事实证明她直到7:30才真正着陆。如果她在1:30登陆，三个小时后，您会遇到麻烦，您会出现，因为Siri的答案准确。

至少可以说，苹果宣布产品延迟是非常不寻常的。 1白色iPhone 4本来应该在2010年6月与黑色iPhone一起首次亮相，但奇怪的是被推迟了几次（我不止一次玩乐），直到明年4月底，迟到了10个月。最初的AirPods于2016年9月与iPhone 7一起宣布，原定于10月发货。他们最终被推迟到12月。苹果在2016年10月的声明中，关于AirPods被延迟， 如TechCrunch的Matthew Panzarino ：

“对Airpods的早期反应令人难以置信。我们不相信在产品准备就绪之前运送产品，并且在AirPods为客户准备好之前，我们需要更多的时间。”

这就是为什么Apple掌握了几乎宗教政策，即在准备好之前没有宣布产品。当他们确实做出例外时（如上所述，如上所述（如下），他们经常后悔。您不能打破从未做出的承诺，也不能错过您从未宣布的船约会。即使有才华横溢的团队和现实的经理，您期望一个项目需要花费多长时间和实际需要多长时间之间的范围也很长。即使使用可预测的技术，工程时间表也经常滑倒，而LLMS的非确定性使他们的未来本质上是不可预测的。

苹果情报的大部分感觉就像苹果公司已经将其推迟了一年，比公司通常的烘焙水平提前了一年。我全年都认为，如果整个行业与华尔街一起 - 没有进入生成型/LLM躁狂症，那么直到今年的WWDC而不是去年才宣布“苹果情报”。今天的宣布令人失望，但对我来说毫不奇怪。通过应用程序意图与个人数据的Siri集成从未感觉像在今年的OS周期中为真实客户使用做好准备的事情。而且，如果苹果公司的一般政策在准备好之前不运送产品，则适用于涉及LLM访问深度私人式智障信息的产品十倍。要迟到，但准备就绪，比运送一些未完成或不可靠的东西要命中应许的截止日期。凭借下一代Siri之类的东西，我想说这是至关重要的。苹果可以将今天的宣布不良宣布正在引起。他们负担不起浪费用户的信任。

  1. 当然，现代时代的苹果产品延迟的祖父是Airpower- Apple在2017年9月与iPhone X和iPhone 8一起预言的多设备（iPhone，Apple Watch，AirPods）充电设备。它最终从未发货，但直到2019年3月29日，该插头才正式拉动（可以这么说），这是在宣布18个月后荒谬的。 ↩︎

entry.summary: 从迪士尼大小的公司的角度来看，永远将FiveThirtyEight的网站永远留在周围。多么耻辱。
entry.content:
奥利弗·达西（Oliver Darcy），报告（paywalled，las），关于fivethirtyeight的突然消亡：

网络总裁Almin Karamehmedovic在周三早上，在宣布裁员的全力备忘录宣布裁员后不久，加入了与FiveThirtyeight团队的虚拟会议。 ABC新闻拥有的政治分析网站上的15名员工通过华尔街日报的报告了解到了前一天晚上，他们被放开了。现在，他们亲自从卡拉梅迈托维奇那里听到了这句话。

但是，像其他经理在当天在ABC新闻上进行大规模裁员的其他经理人一样，对此几乎没有话要说。有人告诉我，当他传达毁灭性消息时，他似乎正在从剧本中读书。他没有提供有关为什么迪士尼拥有的网络决定关闭FiveThirtyeight的原因，该网络与Data Whiz和当时的编辑Nate Silver一起收购。他没有提出任何疑问。他只是感谢员工的工作，告诉他们人力资源员工将跟进，并结束了会议。有人告诉我，整个事件持续了大约15分钟。不久之后，员工可以访问ABC新闻的系统关闭，而FiveThirtyeight网站也被脱机。就这样，它结束了。

业务是业务，裁员和关闭绝不是创伤。但是，有一种正确的方法可以做事和错误的方法。错误的方法之一是让工作人员发现自己都通过阅读《华尔街日报》而被解雇。这个家伙Karamehmedovic听起来像是一个真正的A级笨蛋。

与这些公司关闭网站时毫不客气地插入插件的公司怎么办？为什么不将FiveThirtyEight网站启动和运行 - 至少一段时间（即使不永久）？为静态/存档网站运行服务器几乎没有花费。我不明白。它背叛了对该网站主持的作品的深刻不尊重。如果他们想关闭FiveThirtyeight作为一个持续的关注，这是ABC的业务，但是多年的工作值得保持在线，这都是出于对那些成立次数的人的尊重以及可能仍然想提及它的观众的尊重。迪士尼没有像Touchstone Pictures这样关闭的子公司工作室燃烧电影。

旧的印刷世界与在线出版的新世界之间存在着巨大的鸿沟。这种区别是深刻的，但在很大程度上被忽略了，因为仅适应不同形式的媒体的本质并迅速接受当前的媒体形式是“正常”是人的本性。通过印刷，对观众来说，问题在很大程度上是短暂的。您每天都会收到一份报纸，每周或一个月都会杂志，并且在阅读它们后会扔掉它们。如果您想回顾一下该报纸每年，一个月甚至几天前都发表了关于某些内容的内容，那么您就不幸了，就可以当场查找。图书馆员从事Yeoman的工作，将报纸和杂志归为缩微胶卷，所以什么都没有消失或遗忘，但是访问缩微胶卷档案是一种巨大的麻烦。您几乎必须知道您想看到的问题的日期，并且必须用页面上的眼球进行“搜索”。今天，任何人都可以立即访问一周，一个月，年甚至数十年的故事的能力是网络出版物的令人叹为观止的优势。在过去的15年左右的时间里，我们有能力从我们所有人的口袋里都携带的小机器来做到这一点。这是真的很棒。

但是关闭Web出版物时的标准行为就是仅拉插头。当整个公司陷入困境时，那是一回事。但是，当有一家母公司，尤其是一家蓬勃发展的公司时，除了无视这项工作之外，没有其他理由来拉插头。从迪士尼大小的公司的角度来看，永远将FiveThirtyEight的网站永远留在周围。多么耻辱。

entry.title: ★ABC关闭FiveThirtyEight，并在其网站上拉插头
Apple宣布，MAC Max和M3 Ultra（！）筹码感到惊讶，Mac Studios
entry.content:
杰森·斯内尔（Jason Snell），六种颜色：

对于渴望使用电源的桌面MAC用户， M4 MAC Mini 非常诱人，Apple已将Mac Studio升级以爆炸超过Mini的性能。基本型号仍起价1999美元，由以前仅在M4 MacBook Pro中提供的M4 Max芯片提供动力。新的高端Mac Studio的价格为3999美元，由32个CPU核心（包括24个性能核心）和多达80 GPU内核的可怕芯片提供动力。这是一个从未见过的芯片 - M3 Ultra。

你听到了我。对于苹果有史以来最快的Mac（很明显），Apple是根据Apple先前的处理器生成的两个高端芯片（与Apple的Ultrafusion Technology融合在一起的）的筹码。怪异，对吗？似乎在这里发生了一些事情：首先，Ultra Chip的开发需要更长的时间，并且Apple不会承诺在每一代芯片一代中运输超级芯片。其次，苹果芯片制作伙伴TSMC的第一代三纳米芯片过程并没有像一般认为的那样死亡和埋葬。就在本周，Apple还推出了带有M3处理器的iPad Air，当然， 新的iPad Mini用A17 Pro处理器基于同一过程。

这款M3/M4世代叉 - M3 Ultra Chip与M4 Max一起在新的Mac Studio模型中首次亮相 - 是如此出乎意料，以至于在我昨天关于新闻的禁运新闻发布会上，我以为Apple Rep sisspoke当他说M3而不是M4的M4。但是，不，超级芯片确实是一代人。当被问到一个明显的问题时 - 为什么 - 苹果的答案很简单：超级芯片需要更长的时间才能工程师。

在计算上，M4 Max Studio模型与10月30日首次亮相的M4 Max MacBook Pros相当（确切地说），在16 CPU内核，40 GPU内核，8 TB存储和128 GB的RAM上最大化（无双关）。 M4 Max Studio型号的起价为2,000美元，但该起价仅为您提供14核CPU，32核GPU，16核神经发动机，512 GB的存储空间和36 GB的RAM。

有趣的M3 Ultra车型起价为4,000美元，可为您提供28核CPU，60核GPU，32核神经发动机，1 TB的存储空间和健康的96 GB RAM。可用的升级到Ultra型号：

  • 32核CPU + 80核GPU： + $ 1,500
  • 256 GB的RAM： +$ 1,600
  • 512 GB的RAM： +$ 4,000（仅适用于32核CPU/80核GPU）

Ultra型号的SSD存储选项可达16 TB（基本存储比售价为4,600美元）。

网络是通往信息提供信息的理想媒介都没关系。 Web浏览器现在几乎可以完成本机应用程序可以做的所有事情都没关系。

在许多方面，我希望这是一个技术问题。 At least then we could lobby for some technical advancement that would fix this situation.

But this is not a technical problem. This is a people problem. Specifically, the people who make websites.

There are mobile web proponents who are in denial about this state of affairs, who seek to place the blame at Apple's feet for the fact that WebKit is the only rendering engine available on iOS. But WebKit's limitations have nothing to do with the reasons so many websites suck when experienced on mobile devices. The mobile web sucks just as bad on Android. Apple's WebKit-only rule on iOS is just a useful scapegoat for the fact that most websites, as experienced on phones, are designed and engineered to suck. It's not whatever features WebKit lacks that Chrome-myopic web developers want. It's all the crap that web developers add — tens of megabytes of JavaScript libraries and frameworks; pop-ups and pop-overs all over the screen; scrolljacking and other deliberate breakage of built-in UI behavior — that makes the experience suck. We should be so lucky if the biggest problems facing the web experience on iPhones were the technical limitations of WebKit.

And the app experiences from the same companies (whose websites suck on mobile) are much better. Not a little better, but a lot better — as I wrote in a piece in January . The truth hurts, just like the experience of using most websites on mobile.

entry.title: The Size of the US Federal Workforce Has Not Grown in the Last 50 Years
entry.content:
John Cassidy, writing for The New Yorker (requires a free account to read, annoyingly):

Of course, these calculations can't be taken literally. Even Musk has said that he wants to protect essential workers. If the entire federal workforce were eliminated, there'd be no one to make sure that federal benefits got paid or that federal taxes were collected. The spending and revenue figures would crater; essential services like veterans' hospitals, air-traffic-control systems, and border-crossing stations would be completely abandoned. But this thought experiment does illustrate the point that “bloated” payrolls aren't what is driving federal spending and deficits. Since the nineteen-seventies, as the accompanying chart shows, the total number of federal employees has remained fairly steady.

Here's a copy of the chart . Cassidy continues:

Unlike the figures from the US Office of Personnel Management, the chart, which comes from the Federal Reserve Economic Database, counts members of the US Postal Service as federal employees. It does show that the federal workforce has grown in recent years, but it's still no larger than it was thirty or forty years ago. During the interim, total employment elsewhere in the economy has grown steadily alongside population growth. Consequently, the size of the federal workforce relative to the workforce at large has fallen considerably, as the following chart shows.

Here's a copy of that second chart .

I knew the supposed justifications for the whole DOGE endeavor were a sham, but until this piece I was under the incorrect assumption that the federal government workforce has been growing steadily for decades, at least keeping pace with its percentage of the overall US workforce. The opposite is true — because the federal workforce size has remained steady while the population has continued to grow, its share of the overall workforce has in fact shrunk considerably.

entry.content:
Nora Deligter, writing for Screen Slate in June 2023, “ Elegy for the Screenshot ”:

About five years ago, Catherine Pearson started taking screenshots of every bouquet featured on The Nanny (1993–1999), the six-season CBS sitcom that was then streaming on Netflix. She was just becoming a florist, and she found the arrangements — ornate, colorful, and distinctly tropical — inspirational. She now keeps them in a folder on her desktop, alongside screenshots of flower arrangements featured on Poirot (1989–2013), the British detective drama. A few months ago, however, Pearson suddenly found that when her fingers danced instinctively toward Command-Shift-3, she was greeted by a black box where her flowers used to be, a censored version of what she had meant to capture.

大约在这个时候，Netflix，HBO Max，Amazon Prime等流媒体平台在屏幕截图上施加了一个安静的禁运。起初，有解决方法：用户可以通过使用浏览器勇敢或下载扩展名或Fireshot（例如Fireshot）来继续屏幕截图。 But gradually, the digital-rights-management tech adapted and became more sophisticated.如今，几乎不可能从最受欢迎的流媒体服务中屏幕截图，至少不是在Macintosh计算机上。 [...]

For PC users, this story takes a different, and happier, turn. With the use of Snipping Tool — a utility exclusive to Microsoft Windows, users are free to screen grab content from all streaming platforms.这似乎是一个尖锐的疏忽，在流媒体中，由于其假定的文化阶级而排除了Mac用户（尽管它们占市场的一小部分）。 This assumption isn't unreasonable.在接受本文采访的每个人中，只有一个是PC用户。

Deligter's essay has been sitting in my long (and ever-growing) list of things to link to ever since she published it back in 2023. I referenced it in my post earlier today re: Matthew Green's entreaty to Apple to add “disappearing messages” to iMessage, and re-reading it made me annoyed enough to finally write about it.

我不确定这是什么技术答案，但是在MacOS上，它似乎涉及GPU和视频解码硬件。这些DRM停电发生在如此低的水平上，以至于没有高级软件（您可能会安装的任何实用程序）可以围绕它们路由。我认为Windows仍然可以轻松地从DRM视频中轻松屏幕截图，这并不是因为流媒体服务不在乎Windows用户的工作（考虑到Windows的市场份额，当您想到它时，这将是一件奇怪的事情，而不是关心Windows的市场份额），而是因为Windows使用了不太复杂的成像图像管道。或者也许不是不那么复杂的，更准确地说整合的整合是更准确的。这些DRM停电在Apple设备上（您无法从iPhone或iPad上的DRM视频中捕获屏幕截图）通过OS和硬件之间的深入集成启用，从而使停电在硬件级别上强加。而且，我认为流媒体服务首先使用DRM“保护”他们的视频外，也没有选择进入此屏幕截图禁令。如果视频受到DRM保护，则无法屏幕截图；如果不是，您可以。

在Mac上，曾经是DRM视频在Safari中的屏幕捕获中被遮盖的情况，而不是在Chrome（或数十种铬衍生的浏览器）中进行的。但是在几年前的某个时候，默认情况下，您也不再能够从Chrome的DRM视频中捕获屏幕截图。但是在Chrome的设置页面中，在系统下，如果您禁用“可用时使用图形加速度”，并且重新启动Chrome，Boom，则可以在Chrome窗口中筛选所有内容，包括DRM视频。您可以在切换此设置之前和之后转到Magic URL chrome://gpu/以查看有关差异的完整报告 - 如您所期望的那样，它关闭了所有用于视频编码/解码，组合等的硬件加速度。您不想一直这样浏览（当然不是电池电量），但是对于从视频中捕获静止图像，这是一个很好的技巧。

我不明白的是，为什么Apple首先会为硬件加速视频而烦恼（这都是iOS平台上的视频 - 没有解决方法，例如在iPhone或iPad上使用硬件加速度使用硬件加速度）。没有人会创建一个由DRM保护的视频创建的盗版副本。 MacOS和iOS中的这种“功能”并不像盗版DRM保护的视频内容结束了。 This “feature” accomplishes nothing of value for anyone, including the streaming services, but imposes a massive (and for most people, confusing and frustrating) hindrance on honest people simply trying to easily capture high-quality (as opposed to, say, using their damn phone to take a photograph of their reflective laptop display) screenshots of the shows and movies they're watching.

但是我认为这将让对完美的渴望妨碍提供有用和足够好的功能。在其他平台上使用消失消息的人（正如Green指出的那样，Imessage的所有竞争对手都提供了该功能 - 都可以理解风险。很少有人理解“在运输中加密”和“端到端加密”之间的区别。但是，几乎每个人都直观地了解，即使是“消失的信息”也可能会被屏幕截图，拍照或以其他方式录制。 There's an implicit trust between sender and recipient.

我能想到的另一个角度是复杂性。消息是苹果最常用的应用程序之一，在许多方面，它示例了苹果的一般软件设计和计算方法。 Where critics see an app that is popular despite offering fewer features than its rivals, Apple (and I) see an app that is popular and beloved to some degree because it offers fewer features.所有新功能必定会增加一些复杂性，而消失的消息将增加很多。您可以与同一个人/团体，一个标准和一个短暂的聊天吗？如果是这样，现在您已经提出了意外发送意图是与该人或团体的非肢体聊天的信息的幽灵。如果没有，您如何与您想要永远保留的信息档案的人发送简短的消失传说交流？ （也许在Safari中私人浏览的想法可以作为在消息中消失消息的灵感 - 一种完全不同的模式，具有独特的视觉状态。）

消失消息的基本思想非常微不足道，很容易理解。在消息中实施它们的好设计并不是很微不足道的。不过，解决这些硬设计问题是使苹果苹果的原因。他们为消息添加了一些相当肤浅的功能（例如， genmoji和消息效果），所以我同意绿色的观点，他们应该处理消失的消息，并且当然，他们可以找到一种方法来做到这一点，而增加的复杂性不会造成困惑。可以肯定的是，这是一个艰难的挑战，但值得一提。苹果的设计师也确实可以为此带来一些乐趣，并通过视觉上展示“消失”的新方法。

entry.summary: iPhone 16e是一种iPhone，适合那些不想考虑手机太多的人。但是他们 *确实想要iPhone，而不仅仅是任何“任何”手机。一个简单的iPhone，带有良好的屏幕，足够好（和简单）的相机以及良好的电池寿命。
entry.content:
我过去六天使用了iPhone 16e，经验是一种回报。从许多方面来说，iPhone 16e看起来和感觉就像史蒂夫·乔布斯（Steve Jobs）时代iPhone的现代后代。诸如塑料3G和3GS以及玻璃背面/金属侧4和4s之类的早期iPhone更简单。两种颜色，黑白。单镜头不起眼的相机。 iPhone 16e感觉就像他们的直接后代。

让我们从相机开始。 iPhone 16E相机仅在背面只有一个镜头，与双镜头和三镜弟兄相比，iPhone 16e相机看起来不太明显，而且感觉不太明显。尤其是对我来说，来自日常驾驶iPhone Pro型号的几年，16e的手和口袋的感觉非常小，因为它缺少iPhone 16和16 Pro摄像机镜头进一步伸出的整个“ Mesa”突出。

苹果针对iPhone厚度的技术规格不包括相机镜头或相机台面。苹果只是测量并报告手机平坦非摄像机部分的厚度。但是那些相机模块和镜头伸出了很多。使用数字卡钳，我测量了16e，常规16和16 Pro的三个“级别”的厚度：

根据台面镜头
iPhone 16e 7.8mm - 9.5mm
iPhone 16 7.8mm 9.6mm 11.3mm
iPhone 16 Pro 8.3毫米10.3mm 12.5mm

因此，16e不仅完全省略了台面，而且从镜头到前显示器的整个相机的厚度都比其台面上的iPhone 16和iPhone 16 Pro的厚度小，甚至不包括镜头。

只需查看Apple比较页面中的此屏幕截图，以显示所有三个并排的黑色选项：

iPhone 16e看起来像是一部手机，背面带有微型相机。 iPhone 16 Pro看起来像是一部恰好是手机的相机。您也确实可以感觉到手头上的差异 - 不仅是体重，而且平衡。 1您可以感觉到16个Pro的额外相机硬件增加了额外的重量。根据苹果的规格，iPhone 16e重167克； 16 Pro 199g - 差异16％。 （还要注意一个聪明的触摸：苹果的每个手机的默认壁纸，巧妙地表明它们拥有多少个相机镜头。）

16e相机镜头并没有与手机的背面冲洗，但是它很少（按我的尺寸为1.7毫米）突出，以至于它可以回到iPhone摄像头刚开始从手机后面伸出的时候。 16e在桌面上放置时仍会摆动，但比常规iPhone 16或尤其是iPhone 16 Pro的摄像机模块显得差不多。但是16e的1.7毫米相机镜头的突起是如此之最小，以至于在案例中，手机确实完全平放在桌子上，因为盒子不需要保护镜头，因为16e相机镜头的突出小于壳体的厚度。 （苹果在39美元的硅胶盒中包括我的评论套件中的两个，蓝色和黑色。它们很好，感觉就像苹果的通常有机硅盒一样。）

由于最近的常规和Pro iPhone型号上的“宏”模式使用了0.5×Ultrawide摄像头，因此16E没有次级镜头，因此16E没有宏模式。从iPhone 13 Pro开始，宏模式使iPhone Pros可以专注于小于一英寸的物体。但是，由于16e的1倍相机的传感器比更昂贵的iPhone型号上的1×相机具有较小的传感器和较小的镜头，因此它能够以较短的距离进行焦点，而不是那些更大，更好的1×相机。 iPhone 16 Pro上的1倍摄像头的最小聚焦距离为24厘米（〜9.5英寸）。 iPhone 16e上的1×相机的最小聚焦距离为12厘米（〜4.75英寸）。实际的宏模式（在常规iPhone和Pro iPhone型号上）更好，但是当16e的孤独相机可以在常规拍摄模式下，只需4英寸以上的距离，就不需要太多。

当然，16e的不起眼的相机具有价格：图像质量。您确实可以看到弱光的差异。 16E相机的速度较慢（导致具有运动中的受试者的模糊图像），并且图像更嘈杂。当卤化物中的过程为零时，在低光中拍摄时，差异尤其明显。不过，这是一个很好的相机，出于刻痕目的。对于大多数可能正在考虑使用iPhone 16e的人，它可能是他们拥有的最好的相机。而且，只有一个镜头的简单性，提供1×和2倍的视野，就有话要说。如果您知道什么是ƒ停车，则可能不应该购买iPhone 16e。如果您不知道什么是ƒ停车，则可能不会注意到iPhone 16甚至16 Pro的相机质量有任何差异。对于只想要一个体面的相机的任何人来说，这是一个完美的相机。

缺少的是：magsafe，晋升和超宽带（以及，其他超宽带）

仔细阅读Apple的比较页面，将16E与16个Pro和常规16进行比较，您会发现数十个小差异。但是，一个遗漏吸引了最大的关注（并产生了最“ WTF Apple？”反应）是Magsafe。我拥有一堆Magsafe外围设备，而没有它，个人就不会购买iPhone。我的桌子上有一个码头（备用模式很棒），床头柜上的充电器，以及像这种磁性折叠台这样的方便的doodads。 One week into using the 16e as my main phone, and I still miss MagSafe as much as I did the first night.

But according to Apple representatives, most people in the 16e's target audience exclusively charge their phones by plugging them into a charging cable. They tend not to use inductive charging at all, and when they do, they might not care that the 16e is stuck with a pokey 7.5W Qi charging speed, when recent more expensive iPhones charge via MagSafe at 15W or even 25W. For me, it's not the high charging speed I miss most; it's the snapping into place. 2 I think Apple knows the 16e's intended audience better than I do. Daring Fireball readers aren't in the 16e demographic; it's the friends and family members of DF readers who are.

What features do typical low-end iPhone buyers care about? They want a phone that looks good, with a good display, a decent camera, and long battery life. Do they care that the 16e only supports Wi-Fi 6, not 7? No, because they have zero idea what Wi-Fi version numbers even mean. They just think Wi-Fi is Wi-Fi. Do they care about superspeed mmWave 5G networking from Verizon (aka “ultra wideband”)? No. They just want their cellular connection to be fast and strong. (My review unit from Apple came with a temporary eSIM on AT&T. Cellular connections were fast and strong all week. The only place where I noticed a weak signal was in a deeply suburban / borderline rural area while visiting family over the weekend; my wife's iPhone 15 Pro Max lost its signal on Verizon at the same location. I have zero complaints about Apple's C1 modem.)

The iPhone 16e also omits the other “ultra wideband” , the chip Apple uses for precise location detection — like tracking an AirPod to within a foot. Precision finding is super cool, and when you're truly bedeviled by a lost item like a keychain, remarkably helpful. Ultra wideband has been included on all new iPhones other than the SE (and now 16e) since the iPhones 11 in 2019. From a nerd's perspective, it really does seem like a curious omission from the 16e five years later. But how many people in your extended family know what “ultra wideband precision finding” is?

To date, only Apple's iPhone Pro models have supported ProMotion — Apple's marketing name for a display that features adaptive refresh rates that go up to 120 Hz and down to 1 Hz for the “Always On” display mode. Given that the regular iPhone 16 (and 16 Plus) don't support ProMotion, there was zero chance the 16e would. There are mid-range Android phones with high-refresh-rate displays, but (a) I don't think they're better displays, all things considered, and (b) they're mid-range Android phones. It's like bragging about the refresh rate on the dashboard display in a Kia Sorento. The 16e display also sports a throwback notch in lieu of the fancier, more playful, and at times cleverly useful, dynamic island.

The iPhone 16e targets the “I only care about the basics” iPhone buyer: the screen looks good, the camera is good but simple, the battery lasts a long time (the difference should be quite striking for anyone upgrading from a four- or five-year-old iPhone), it runs all their existing apps, and it charges fast when plugged into a USB cable. Those are the basics, and the basics are all that casual users care about. That it's lighter in weight and physically smaller thanks to its minimally protruding single camera lens is gravy.

定价

The only aspect of the 16e garnering more discussion than its omission of MagSafe is its starting price of $600 for a 128 GB base model. “It should cost $100 less” say some people, who tend to be the same people who also strongly believe it should include MagSafe and a ProMotion display. Here's Apple's current iPhone lineup, plus the discontinued (but still available from some carriers) 3rd-generation SE:

iPhone芯片64 GB 128 GB 256 GB 512 GB 1 TB
SE (3rd gen) A15 $ 430 $ 480 $ 580 - -
16e A18 - $ 600 $ 700 $900 -
15 A16 - $ 700 $ 800 $ 1000 -
16 A18 - $ 800 $900 $ 1100 -
16 Plus A18 - $900 $ 1000 $ 1200 -
16 Pro A18 Pro - $ 1000 $ 1100 $ 1300 $ 1500
16 Pro Max A18 Pro - - $ 1200 $ 1400 $1600

That's a tidy pricing matrix with $100 increments. The new 16e starting at $600 makes more sense than the old SE starting at just $430. $600 is clearly the next logical “rung” under the year-old iPhone 15's $700 starting price. Complaining that Apple no longer makes a phone that's priced in the $400-500 range is like complaining that BMW no longer makes any cars that cost less than $40,000. They're Apple. It's an iPhone. Of course it costs more than a no-name Android phone, or the 27th model down the ladder in Samsung's sprawling product lineup. Anyone who wants to spend less than $600 for an iPhone can buy one from the flourishing pre-owned/refurbished market — just like buying a BMW for under $40,000.

iPhone 16e是一种iPhone，适合那些不想考虑手机太多的人。 But they do want an iPhone, not just any “whatever” phone.一个简单的iPhone，带有良好的屏幕，足够好（和简单）的相机以及良好的电池寿命。 I think Apple nailed that with the iPhone 16e.

  1. There's a decided feel difference with the side rails of the 16e too. The sides feel sharper, less rounded, than the regular 16 and 16 Pro (and the 15/15 Pro, and 14/14 Pro ...). That squareness (sharp-cornered-ness?) isn't bad, per se, but it does subtly convey a sense of the 16e being a less premium device. ↩︎

  2. One of the most surprising aspects of my professional life in recent years is how much time I spend thinking and writing about magnets. But the “snapping into place” thing does raise the question of why Apple didn't include magnets in its cases for the 16e. ↩︎

Washington Post: 'Biden Justice Department Downplayed UK Demand for Apple “Back Door”'
entry.content:
Joseph Menn, reporting for The Washington Post:

The US Justice Department told Congress in November there were no major disputes with the United Kingdom over how the two allies seek data from each other's communication companies.

But at that time, officials knew British authorities were preparing a demand that Apple build a back door to its users' encrypted data, according to people familiar with the process, who spoke on the condition of anonymity to discuss internal department matters. [...]

The department said it reminded its British counterpart of the CLOUD Act's “requirement that the terms of the Agreement shall not create any obligation that providers be capable of decrypting data.” The report did not mention the looming order, and said any demands for reduced security would come under Britain's Investigatory Powers Act, and so were not within the scope of the CLOUD Act.

On Wednesday, Sen. Alex Padilla and Rep. Zoe Lofgren, both California Democrats, faulted the November certification, saying “it splits the finest of hairs” by suggesting that the CLOUD Act didn't apply to any decryption order. The two lawmakers, who sit on the Judiciary committees in their respective chambers of Congress, asked Bondi to reconsider whether Britain was violating the Cloud Act by ordering a break to Apple's encryption.

Two of the people familiar with the certification process said the FBI has pursued backdoor capabilities unsuccessfully in the United States and would have been in a stronger legal position to win that if Apple had already had to create such a mechanism for another government.

Just utterly disgraceful behavior from the Biden administration — choosing to look the other way at a clear violation of the CLOUD Act to help their purported buddies in the UK, at the direct expense of a US company's autonomy and US citizens' privacy. I don't see how this dissembling can be defended. Upon learning of the UK's odious demands on Apple, the Biden administration's response wasn't to defend Apple (or Americans' privacy), but instead to try to hide it from Congress.虚幻。

★

entry.title: Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard Suggests UK Broke Agreement in Secretly Demanding That Apple Build iCloud Backdoor
entry.content:
Zac Hall, reporting for 9to5Mac:

According to a letter seen by 9to5Mac, the Trump Administration is investigating whether the UK may have broken a bilateral agreement when secretly demanding that Apple build a global backdoor into iCloud.

Trump's Director of National Intelligence Tulsi Gabbard wrote in a letter responding to Senator Ron Wyden of Oregon and Representative Andy Biggs of Arizona that she was not made aware of the UK's secret demand by her UK counterparts. However, she suggested, the UK government may have broken a bilateral privacy and surveillance agreement in making the demand.

Gabbard's letter is available here (and I'm hosting a copy ). From her letter:

Thank you for your letter dated 13 February 2025 concerning reported actions by the United Kingdom toward Apple that could undermine Americans' privacy and civil liberties at risk. I am aware of the press reporting that the UK Home Secretary served Apple with a secret order directing the company to create a “back door” capability in its iCloud encryption to facilitate UK government access to any Apple iCloud users' uploaded data anywhere in the world. I share your grave concern about the serious implications of the United Kingdom, or any foreign country, requiring Apple or any company to create a “backdoor” that would allow access to Americans personal encrypted data. This would be a clear and egregious violation of Americans' privacy and civil liberties, and open up a serious vulnerability for cyber exploitation by adversarial actors.

I was not made aware of this reported order, either by the United Kingdom government or Apple, prior to it being reported in the media. I have requested my counterparts at CIA, DIA, DHS, FBI and NSA to provide insights regarding the publicly reported actions, and will subsequently engage with UK government officials. The UK's Investigatory Powers Act of 2016, also known as the Snoopers' Charter, which I understand would be at issue, allows the UK to issue a “gag order,” which would prevent Apple or any company from voicing their concerns with myself, or the public. [...]

My lawyers are working to provide a legal opinion on the implications of the reported UK demands against Apple on the bilateral Cloud Act agreement. Upon initial review of the US and UK bilateral CLOUD Act Agreement, the United Kingdom may not issue demands for data of US citizens, nationals, or lawful permanent residents (“US persons”), nor is it authorized to demand the data of persons located inside the United States. The same is true for the United States — it may not use the CLOUD Act agreement to demand data of any person located in the United Kingdom.

I'm so pleased by Gabbard's response here, including making it public, that I'm gladly willing to overlook her “back door”/”backdoor” and “UK”/”UK” inconsistencies. ( DF style is now to close it up: backdoor .)

Short of the UK backing down and retracting its secret demand for an iCloud backdoor from Apple, this is the best that Apple and privacy advocates could hope for. The gag-order aspect of the UK's Investigatory Powers Act prevented Apple from even fighting it in court. But a US ruling that would hold it illegal for Apple to comply would put Apple in an impossible situation, where they can't comply with a UK legal demand without violating the law of the home country. That would actually give Apple the ground to fight this in the UK.

It is not coincidental that UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer is set to visit the White House tomorrow . This is a message in advance that the US considers all aspects of this demand on Apple unacceptable.

★

entry.title: Downie 4
entry.content:
I referenced Downie twice earlier today — once in my item linking to Charlie Monroe (developer of Downie) writing about the indie app business, and earlier in my post about using Downie to download the MP3 from Jony Ive's interview on the BBC's Desert Island Discs.

I somehow hadn't heard of (or more likely, just hadn't noticed) Downie until a few weeks ago, when I first came across Monroe's blog post , via Michael Tsai . Here's the pitch for Downie, from its website:

Ever wished you could save a video from the Internet? Search no more, Downie is what you're looking for. Easily download videos from thousands of different sites.

就是这样。 You give it a web page URL, and Downie will download any video (or audio) files embedded on the page. Downie offers all sorts of convenience features, like browser extensions, post-processing, and more. But the main interface is super obvious and easy.

For years, I've used the open source yt-dlp command-line tool for this task (and before yt-dlp, its predecessor, youtube-dl). When I saw Downie, I thought to myself, “ That looks cool, but I don't really download that many video or audio files to justify paying for a commercial app. ” But then I slapped myself (figuratively) and I realized I should at least try it. I'm so glad I did. It's like using Transmit instead of the command-line tools for secure FTP connections. It's cool that the Mac has a Unix terminal interface and support for zillions of free and open source utilities, but the point of using a Mac is to use great Mac apps. And Downie is a great Mac app.

What I've found over the last month isn't just that I enjoy using Downie far more than invoking yt-dlp, but that I use Downie more often than I used yt-dlp, because it's so much easier and more reliable. For example, when I wrote about Fox Sports's new scorebug that debuted in the Super Bowl, I used Downie to download local 4K copies of this month's Super Bowl 59, along with Super Bowl 57 from two years ago, to compare Fox's new scorebug with their previous one. Local video files are easy to navigate frame-by-frame to capture the perfect screenshot; YouTube's website makes it impossible to navigate frame-by-frame.

Downie is a $20 one-time purchase (and is also included with a Setapp subscription). I've only been using it for a month or so, and I already feel like I've gotten $20 of utility from it. (I went ahead and bought Monroe's other major app, Permute , too.)

★

entry.summary: 英国的需求同时令人发动，数学上无知（关于端到端加密的性质），这是危险的（正如最近的盐台台风袭击中国所证明的那样，中国成功地发动了对美国的非E2EE通信的窃听），以及对英国在英国的实际权力和世界上的卑鄙的态度而荒谬。
entry.content:
苹果在今天早上发给媒体的非常精确的措辞陈述中：

苹果不再向新用户提供英国的高级数据保护（ADP），而当前的英国用户最终将需要禁用此安全功能。 ADP使用端到端加密保护iCloud数据，这意味着只有拥有数据的用户才能解密数据，并且只能在其受信任的设备上进行解密。我们感到非常失望的是，鉴于数据泄露和对客户隐私的其他威胁，ADP提供的保护将无法为我们的客户提供。通过端到端加密增强云存储的安全性比以往任何时候都更加紧迫。苹果仍然致力于为我们的用户提供最高的个人数据安全性，并希望我们将来能够在英国的情况下这样做。正如我们以前多次说过的那样，我们从未为我们的任何产品或服务建立后门或主钥匙，我们永远也不会。

这是两周前约瑟夫·梅恩（Joseph Menn）在《华盛顿邮报》（Washington Post）和《金融时报》中蒂姆·布拉德肖（Tim Bradshaw）的消息（引用Menn的报告，重点添加）：

熟悉此事的人们告诉《华盛顿邮报》，英国的安全官员要求苹果创建一个后门，使他们能够检索所有苹果用户已上传到云的所有内容。上个月发布的英国政府未公开的命令要求覆盖能力以查看完全加密的材料，而不仅仅是在破解特定账户方面的协助，并且在主要民主国家中没有已知的先例。 [...]

人民说，内政大臣办公室已为苹果公司提供了名为“技术能力通知”的文件，命令该文件根据《 2016年英国扫地调查权法》提供访问权限，该法案授权执法部门在需要时在公司收集证据时强迫援助。该法律被批评家称为《窥探者宪章》，这使得政府甚至提出了这种要求是刑事犯罪。苹果发言人拒绝发表评论。

根据定义，端到端的加密可以没有秘密的后门，因此遵守英国的此命令将要求苹果放弃端到端的加密 - 不仅适用于英国的用户，而且在全球所有国家 /地区的所有用户。 1更阴险和令人痛苦的是，他们显然被英国法律所禁止，受到严厉的罚款（监禁），甚至不愿告知公众这一需求，或者，如果他们要遵守，则不愿告诉公众对他们所做的事情。英国希望苹果在没有苹果告诉任何人（包括美国政府）的情况下秘密访问所有iCloud数据，即他们已经授予了英国政府这种令人叹为观止的访问权限。

苹果不是遵守苹果，而是选择从英国提取高级数据保护。对于尚未使用ADP的英国用户，在发送Apple的声明之前已经关闭了启用它的能力。英国广播公司新闻的这份报告提供了屏幕截图，其中包括英国用户今天尝试启用它的内容。

Re-read Apple's statement above, which I've quoted in full, including the hyperlink.引人注目的是，苹果没有提供任何解释，甚至没有提示，为什么该公司“不再向新用户提供英国的高级数据保护（ADP），而当前的英国用户最终将需要禁用此安全功能”。关于与安全和隐私有关的问题，Apple始终尽可能地解释其政策和功能。 The fact that Apple has offered no hint as to why they're doing this is a canary statement of sorts: they're making clear as best they can that they're under a legal gag order that prevents them from even acknowledging that they're under a legal gag order, by not telling us why they're no longer able to offer ADP in the UK.这类读者之间隐含的确认是，他们在堵嘴命令下是他们合法提供的唯一确认，面临监禁的风险。

启用ADP是受控的服务器端，因此Apple能够禁用英国用户在不需要对设备进行软件更新的情况下打开ADP的能力。但是，这是一个悬而未决的问题，对于已经启用ADP的英国用户将如何发挥作用。苹果不能远程禁用ADP。有了一会儿的想法，您可以意识到为什么他们不能：这将击败整个目的。就像Apple无法掌握自己的钥匙以用ADP解密用户数据一样，他们也无法保持禁用ADP的能力。

但是，启用ADP是可逆的。打开它后，用户可以将其恢复为标准保护，并将其关闭。但是他们必须手动确认。我怀疑苹果公司将为已经启用ADP的英国用户做什么是开始发出警告，指示他们在截止日期之前手动禁用它。截止日期过去了，我认为苹果将不得不停止允许iCloud访问英国受ADP保护的帐户。这不会使这些用户的数据没有受到保护 - 他们只会在禁用ADP并恢复标准保护之前就失去了对同步的访问。

最重要的是，英国政府像一个专制的威权国家一样进行。那不是夸张。而且他们命令的令人叹为观止的范围 - 能够秘密地偷偷摸摸，恕不另行通知，他们甚至具有能力，不仅对自己的公民，而且全世界的每个苹果用户都表现出了妄想的信念，即大英帝国仍然存在。它同时令人发指，数学上无知（关于端到端加密的性质），这是危险的（正如最近的盐台风袭击中国成功发动的，在美国的非E2EE通讯中窃取了窃听），并且对英国的实际力量和世界上的力量和地位都很幼稚。

苹果是正确和公义的，告诉他们要他妈的。

  1. 如果您使用高级数据保护，则只能通过自己的设备将iCloud数据解密（a），（b）使用启用ADP时控制的恢复密钥，或（c）您在iCloud中创建的任何恢复联系人。苹果坚持认为，您必须生成一个恢复密钥或指定至少一个恢复联系人才能启用ADP。丢失设备，丢失恢复密钥并丢失iCloud密码，而包括Apple在内的任何人都无法恢复您的iCloud数据。该密码保证的安全性水平是ADP的好处。这也是ADP的风险。而且有便利的费用。例如，Web访问iCloud。 引用苹果自己的ADP文档：

    当用户首先打开高级数据保护时，Web访问其在iCloud.com上的数据将自动关闭。这是因为iCloud Web服务器不再可以访问解密并显示用户数据所需的密钥。用户可以选择再次打开Web访问，并使用其受信任设备的参与来访问其在Web上的加密iCloud数据。

    打开Web访问后，用户必须在每次访问iCloud.com时都会在其受信任设备之一上授权Web登录。授权“武装”用于Web访问的设备。在接下来的一个小时中，此设备接受特定的Apple服务器的请求以上传单个服务键，但仅在ICloud.com上允许的服务列表相对应。换句话说，即使用户授权Web登录，服务器请求也无法诱导用户的设备上传服务键的服务密钥，该密钥不打算在iCloud.com上查看（例如iCloud KeyChain中的健康数据或密码）。 Apple Server仅请求使用用户要求在网络上访问的特定数据所需的服务密钥。每次上传服务密钥时，它都会使用用户授权的Web会话绑定的短暂键进行加密，并在用户的设备上显示通知，显示iCloud Service暂时可用于Apple Servers的数据。

    这是出于“我丢失了唯一的设备并忘记了我的iCloud密码”的原因，并可以轻松地通过Web访问iCloud，因此，高级数据保护并不是所有用户的默认值。

    我认为，从技术上讲，苹果有可能在典型意义上维护“端到端加密”，同时在iCloud中的所有加密数据中添加了另一个由英国控制的签名密钥。假设您拥有两个Apple设备，一个iPhone和一个Mac，并且使用高级数据保护。您的数据只能由这两种设备或您的恢复密钥或由您的恢复联系人之一控制的设备解密。 Apple可以做一些事情，例如将英国政府添加为有效的恢复联系，向世界上加密的iCloud数据中的每个用户添加恢复联系。那仍然是“端到端”，这只是英国政府将控制其中一个终点之一。但是，iCloud安全的设计方式，不能静静地添加类似的安全性。当将新设备添加到您的iCloud帐户中时，所有现有设备都会收到已添加新设备的通知。我个人每年都会看到这些通知每年数百次，因为我在我的帐户中添加了新的审核单元设备。像9月份一样，我得到了四个iPhone 16评论单元，两个Apple Watch评论单元，并购买了自己的iPhone 16 Pro。我拥有几个Mac，几台Apple手表和一张iPad。这些设备中的每个设备都添加到我的iCloud帐户中，甚至只是临时用于测试，就会生成有关正在将新设备添加到我的iCloud帐户中的通知，该设备目前已登录到我的iCloud帐户中。作为产品审阅者，这对我来说是一个小小的烦恼，但是当然，我别无其他方式。 Apple's system is built such that new devices cannot be added to the chain without a notification being generated and sent to every existing device in your account.有关新设备的通知即使在标准保护方面也会发生 - 它并不是启用ADP的用户的独特通知。

    因此，尽管从理论上讲，有些公司可以（我认为？）建立一个公平（但欺骗性地）被描述为“端到端加密”的系统，其中一个“目的”是由英国政府秘密而默默地控制的，但苹果的iCloud并不是这样的系统。不幸的是，不幸的是，英国法律阻止了苹果对此进行解释，但是我认为，苹果当前无法遵守英国对受ADP保护的帐户的要求，因为他们无法在不通知每个帐户的每个设备的情况下向现有的ICLOUD帐户添加一个由英国控制的解密密钥。 ↩︎

entry.summary: 可以说，iPhone 16e的手机比iPhone 15更好，而且我认为它的价值几乎是一个更好的价值，价格少100美元。
entry.content:
上周，蒂姆·库克（Tim Cook）取笑了今天即将到来的“家庭中最新成员”产品公告。事实证明，这是iPhone 16e ，该设备的名字简短地使我犹豫不决地瘫痪了有关如何资本化的设备， 1取代了阵容中的三岁iPhone SE（第三代）。

公告

苹果在当前在其主页上的13分钟视频中宣布了这一消息，但似乎只能在YouTube上挂钩。 （也许是吗？）当然，这也是在Apple新闻编辑室的新闻稿中宣布的。视频的前三分钟以蒂姆·库克（Tim Cook）为特色（谈论iPhone的伟大，尤其是iPhone 16，以及苹果智能）。在接下来的五分钟内，将事情交给iPhone产品营销副总裁Kaiann Drance； Drance主要回顾了iOS 18的Tentpole功能，尤其是Apple Intelligence。 Drance将iPhone产品设计主管的主管露西·布朗宁（Lucy Browning）提出了主题演讲，他谈到了16E的细节。关于视频的最不寻常的是它的设置：不是苹果公园，而不是史蒂夫·乔布斯剧院，而是无限的白色空白，在过去的时代，诸如著名的Hodgman / Long“我是Mac /我是PC”系列之类的Apple TV广告。 （新的无限空隙可以说是浅灰色，而不是白色。）

名字

首先，名称。这不是第四代iPhone SE，而是完全具有新的“ E”后缀。苹果公司使用了iPhone 4s，5s，6s和Xs的“ S”后缀；带有iPhone 5C的“ C”和XR的“ R”。我们将看看此“ E”是否是一次性。在今天的在线新闻发布会上，当被问及“ E”是否代表任何东西时，苹果代表说不，它不属于任何东西，而是为每个人建造的。我认为她并不是要暗示“ E”秘密代表所有人，只是因为我很确定苹果不希望每个人都购买最低价格的iPhone型号。苹果也从来没有对“ SE”名称的解释，尽管在我的脑海中，我已经读过这是有点代表特别版的代表？ Way back in the day, I think Phil Schiller once said the “S” in “iPhone 3GS” stood for speed , because the 3GS was in fact strikingly faster than the prior year's 3G, and the “C” in “iPhone 5C” definitely, if unofficially, stood for color . But it's best not to waste too much time trying to find any logic to this other than that Apple thinks “iPhone 16e” looks and sounds cool. I'm just glad it's not the “iPhone 16 AI”.

Using the “16” generation as part of the name is more interesting than the new “e” suffix. It perhaps suggests that e-edition phones might become annual. I wouldn't bet on that. But the SE models came out in March 2016, April 2020, and March 2022, so the gaps have been irregular. At the very least though, the 16e name will help make it clear, in years to come, what the basic specs of this iPhone were and when, roughly, it debuted. Every time I've referenced the third-gen SE in the last year or two, I've had to look up exactly when it debuted and which A-series chip it sported (A15, same as the iPhone 13).

定价

As expected, the existing third-gen iPhone SE is now out of the lineup. The third-gen SE debuted in March 2022 with a starting price of $430 (for a paltry 64 GB) with 128 and 256 GB configurations for, respectively, $480 and $580. The new iPhone 16e starts at $600, which, depending on how you look at it, is either a $170 increase (in the price of the cheapest new iPhone Apple sells) or a $120 increase (in the price of the cheapest 128 GB iPhone Apple sells). I've already seen gobs of people arguing that the iPhone 16e “should” start at just $500, but if you look at Apple's pricing for the entire iPhone 16 lineup, there are $200 gaps, for the same storage tiers, between the 16e and regular 16, and between the regular 16 and 16 Pro. So I'd argue that $600 is the “right” price. It's also worth pointing out that, according to the US Bureau of Labor Statistics's inflation calculator , $500 in January 2022 is about $565 in January 2025 dollars.

Here's a table with the lineup of new iPhones Apple currently sells. I'm including the now-discontinued iPhone SE for reference. Also note that while these are the only models Apple itself sells to consumers, other old models are still sold by various carriers and retail partners around the world, including the iPhone SE for now.

芯片64 GB 128 GB 256 GB 512 GB 1 TB
iPhone SE A15 $ 430 $ 480 $ 580 - -
iPhone 16e A18 - $ 600 $ 700 $900 -
iPhone 15 A16 - $ 700 $ 800 $1,000 -
iPhone 16 A18 - $ 800 $900 $ 1,100 -
iPhone 16 Pro A18 Pro - $1,000 $ 1,100 $1,300 $ 1,500

iPhone 16 Plus and 16 Pro Max cost $100 more than their regular-size siblings.
iPhone 16 Pro Max is not available with 128 GB, and thus starts at $1,200.

Key differences in the iPhone 16e from the regular iPhone 16 (and iPhone 15), roughly in order of interest, or at least interestingness, to me:

No MagSafe

I find this a surprising omission. The 16e does support inductive Qi charging, but only at a pokey 7.5-watt rate. The regular 16 and 16 Pro models support MagSafe charging at up to 25 watts, and the iPhone 15 at 15 watts. You can charge an iPhone 16e using a MagSafe charging puck, but only at 7.5 watts, and it won't magnetically snap into place. It'll just function as a non-magnetic pad. I don't know if this decision was about component pricing (the $200 difference has to come from somewhere, and it's not going to be Apple's margins), the internal space that MagSafe components occupy in the device (see next section), or marketing differentiation. Probably some combination of all three. The old SE only supported 7.5-watt no-MagSafe Qi charging as well.

电池

Battery life is better than the regular iPhone 16. This is equally surprising to me. From Apple's own Comparison page:

How exactly is the 16e achieving battery life that surpasses the more expensive iPhone 16, and is effectively on par with the much more expensive iPhone 16 Pro? I suspect it's a combination of a larger battery and a more efficient cellular modem. As rumored, the 16e is Apple's first iPhone with an in-house–designed modem, which, in the video, Kaiann Drance introduces thus (emphasis added): “And with iPhone 16e, we're expanding the benefits of Apple silicon with C1, the first Apple-designed cellular modem. It provides fast and reliable 5G connectivity, and it's the most power-efficient modem ever in an iPhone .” Just as with CPUs and GPUs, Apple's interest in custom silicon isn't only about price and performance — it's about efficiency too. Drance then continues (speaking over a cool breakaway animation of the 16e's internal components), “We combined the incredible power efficiency of Apple silicon with an all-new internal design for iPhone 16e that has been optimized for a larger battery. Together, it paves the way for an unprecedented level of battery life in a 6.1-inch iPhone.” There might be other changes that allow the 16e to accommodate a larger battery than the regular 16, but from the spec sheet, the obvious one is the omission of MagSafe.

Apple's C1 Chip

The power efficiency sounds great, and of course the modem supports “5G”, but it doesn't support mmWave / ultra wideband, the crazy super-fast variant of 5G with Wi-Fi-like speed and Wi-Fi-like short range from carrier antennas that serve it. Block-by-block here at home in Philadelphia, I see ultra wideband from Verizon on some blocks of the city ( denoted by the “5G UW” icon in the status bar ), but not most. But do I really care? I honestly don't know why I'm supposed to care about 5G at all compared to LTE. Using LTE instead of 5G (let alone 5G ultra wideband) makes no practical difference for anything I do over cellular on my phone. Obviously Apple wants to support ultra wideband in its own modems eventually, but their renewed deal with Qualcomm — announced and crowed-about only by Qualcomm , because Apple despises them and deeply resents its own dependence upon them — covers “smartphone launches in 2024, 2025 and 2026”. So I don't think we'll see a C-series chip in this September's expected iPhone 17 or 17 Pro — but perhaps we'll see one in the rumored iPhone 17 “Air”.

Remember too that when last I saw it tested — by Nicole Nguyen in 2022 — disabling 5G and exclusively using LTE extended the battery life of an iPhone 13 Pro from 13 to 15.5 hours in her video-streaming test. Ultra wideband 5G is indeed insanely fast , and regular 5G is generally faster than LTE, but for most people in most places not in ways that practically matter, especially considering the effects on battery life. “Plenty fast enough, with longer battery life” is a better trade-off than “way faster than you'll notice, with somewhat shorter battery life”.

Speaking of wireless, I don't know if it's related to the C1 chip, but the iPhone 16e supports only Wi-Fi 6, not 7, and doesn't support Thread networking.

Just One Camera on the Back, but It's “2-in-1”

No surprise here — cameras are expensive, and only offering one makes for very obvious differentiation. Apple's calling this lone camera “2-in-1” because, like the main camera on other recent iPhone models, it offers both 1× and 2× optical fields of view (1× uses the entire 48MP sensor, producing a 12MP image by treating the sensor pixel array as “quad pixels; 2× produces 12MP images by cropping the center 12MP of the sensor). The lack of a second ultra-wide camera means not just no 0.5× lens, but also no macro photography, and no spatial photos or video. The 16e also offers only “Photographic Styles”, not the “latest-generation Photographic Styles” offered by the 16 and 16 Pro .

If you really care about your camera , the iPhone 16e isn't the iPhone for you. As mentioned above, it has fewer lenses and the imaging pipeline doesn't support the next-generation Photographic Styles (which, five months in, I continue to really enjoy in my own photography). But that doesn't mean the iPhone 16e isn't a valid choice for people who care about their photos. Some people really do care about their photography, but also really just point and shoot using their main 1× camera, no matter which iPhone model they own. Not worrying about camera hardware and only concerning yourself with lighting and framing is a philosophy shared by many seriously talented photographers.

No Camera Control Button

The other camera-hardware-related ding against the 16e is that it doesn't have the new Camera Control button/slider on the side. I know several iPhone 16 owners who claim they never use it or even flat out dislike it, because they find themselves invoking it only by accident. I really like it, and use it as my primary way to launch the Camera app and to capture images. But, you know, we all captured images and videos just fine for 17 iPhone generations without that hardware button. No matter how much you like it, you certainly don't need it.

But, up until now, you did need the Camera Control button to invoke the visual intelligence feature of Apple Intelligence . A press-and-release of Camera Control launches your favorite camera app; a long-press invokes visual intelligence. Apple's solution to enable visual intelligence on the iPhone 16e, despite it lacking the Camera Control button, is two-fold. First, visual intelligence is now available in Control Center. Second, as demonstrated by Apple in the announcement video, you can assign the Action Button to visual intelligence. (By default, just as with other iPhones equipped with the Action Button, it defaults to toggling silent mode, like the dedicated ringer switch of yore — where by “yore” I mean still on the iPhone 15.)

Apple representatives also told me today that owners of the iPhone 15 Pro will soon be able to bind their Action Button to visual intelligence, “in a future software update”. I suspect that future software update is iOS 18.4, which should be launching in beta any day now, but Apple wouldn't comment, on or off the record, when exactly this feature will come to the iPhone 15 Pro. They also confirmed that the Control Center button to launch visual intelligence is also coming to iPhone 15 Pro (and presumably iPhone 16 models, too). The iPhone 15 Pro, despite qualifying for Apple Intelligence, has heretofore lacked the visual intelligence feature, because the visual intelligence feature has only been trigger-able via the Camera Control button. It's a little odd, frankly, that Apple didn't enable this feature via the Action Button and Control Center for 15 Pro users months ago — perhaps they really wanted to wait for the 16e announcement?

展示

The 16e display specs seem pretty good, but the front sensor array is behind a notch, not a dynamic island. That's a reasonable design trade-off for the lowest-price model. The 16 and 16 Pro displays offer maximum brightness specs of 1,000 nits (typical), 1,600 nits (HDR), and 2,000 nits (outdoor). The 16e display offers 800 nits (typical), 1,200 (HDR), and doesn't go higher than that. The 16 and 16 Pro dislays also go down to just 1 nit minimum brightness; Apple doesn't list a minimum brightness for the 16e display.

硅

The A18 chip in the iPhone 16e seems (on the specs page) nearly identical to that of the iPhone 16, except for the number of GPU cores: the 16e has only 4 GPU cores, but the regular iPhone 16 has 5. (The A18 Pro chip in the iPhone 16 Pro/Pro Max has 6 GPU cores.) No big whoop.

What's more interesting than comparing to the iPhone 16 is comparing to the iPhone 15, which costs $100 more than the 16e. Because the only A17-generation chip was the A17 Pro that went into the iPhone 15 Pro models, the regular iPhone 15 has the same A16 chip from the iPhone 14 model year. Aside from all the general performance improvements in the A18 compared to the two-year-old A16, the big functional difference is that the iPhone 16e supports Apple Intelligence and the iPhone 15 does not. As covered extensively when Apple Intelligence was announced at WWDC last June, that's mainly a function of RAM, but whatever the reasons, the less expensive iPhone 16e has Apple Intelligence, and the iPhone 15 does not. Maybe that's not a big whoop, but it's definitely a whoop of some sort.

Perhaps, like the three generations of SE models, the iPhone 16e is designed to stay around for several years at this price point. If it does, the fact that it costs $100 less than the “year-old regular iPhone” will make more sense come September, when that $700 year-old model is the iPhone 16. But until September, the iPhone 16e looks like a better phone in several ways than the iPhone 15. It has a faster chip that supports Apple Intelligence and significantly longer battery life. The iPhone 15 does have a 0.5× ultra-wide camera, and it has a slightly better display (that includes the nicer dynamic island instead of a notch). And of course the iPhone 15 comes in colors like pink, yellow, green, and blue. But if you keep your phone in a case all the time, like most people do, you probably don't care about the color of your phone much.可以说，iPhone 16e的手机比iPhone 15更好，而且我认为它的价值几乎是一个更好的价值，价格少100美元。

颜色

You can get any color 16e that you want, so long as it's black or white. The third-gen iPhone SE came in midnight, starlight, and Product Red. (Is Apple done partnering with Product Red now? I think Apple Watch Series 9 was the last device offered with Product Red .)

  1. For a while with the iPhone 4S, there was some ambiguity whether Apple intended the “S” to be upper- or lowercase, because their marketing materials used a small-cap “S”, and a small-cap “S” looks almost exactly like a lowercase “s”. They settled on uppercase for the 4S. But when the iPhone 5S and 5C were released, Apple not only styled both of those suffixes lowercase, they retroactively re-styled the 'S' in the '4S' as lowercase. I wrote about this at length in this footnote in my iPhone 5S and 5C review in 2013 , in which I explained my decision to uppercase them. But I sort of like the way “16e” looks. It's ... friendly? And the lowercase “e” carries the correct implication that this is a lesser sibling to the regular iPhone 16, not an upgrade or superior of some sort. So for now, I'm going with the flow and keeping the “e” lowercase. One friend, to whom I vented my consternation regarding how to handle this, unhelpfully suggested I go with iPhone 16ᵉ . ↩︎
